info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 8:14PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Hunterdon, southwestern Warren, east central Berks, southeastern Lehigh, northwestern Montgomery, northwestern Bucks and southeastern Northampton Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 814 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bally, or 14 miles southwest of Allentown, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Easton, Bethlehem, Emmaus, Quakertown, Wilson, Bedminster, Hellertown, Tinicum, East Greenville, Alpha, Ferndale, Frenchtown, West Easton, Milford, Bally, Bechtelsville, Bloomsbury, Riegelsville and Green Lane. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 39 and 54. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 58 and 76. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Pennsylvania.
